result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert L Brinson appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Robert L Brinson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report , filed.

Defendant Robert L Brinson in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Robert L Brinson.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-25-2022, filed.

Defendant Robert L Brinson in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Michael Schindhelm appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective M. Harms. Court took judicial notice of 95CF1381 and 08CF5173. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Robert L Brinson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris (as a friend of the court).  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for State vs Lee hearing. PD's office unable to appoint for today's hearing and does not appear. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered that defendant does not have to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Atty Thomas in court and accepts appointment. Case adjourned to prelim court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 5524 West Lisbon Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53216

Defendant Robert L Brinson in court by video.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD.

Defendant Robert L Brinson in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Robert L Brinson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Robert L Brinson in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert L Brinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
